GapFillInput.Title: Passive forms
GapFillInput.Instruction: Put the verb in brackets into the correct passive form.

Content.Question:
1. I feel quite nervous. My son is being interviewed|'s being interviewed (interview) for a place at Oxford University to read English as we speak!
2. Jake is a very talented musician, and he should be given (give) a chance to prove himself.
3. John has badly injured his ankle. I doubt he will be allowed|'ll be allowed (allow) to continue the expedition.
4. Richard was really upset at having been left out|being left out (leave out) of the football squad.
5. Five people were hurt (hurt) in the crash on the M40 yesterday evening.
6. If we work as a team there is a huge amount that can be done (do) to improve this company.
7. Visitors aren't allowed (not / allow) to walk on the grass within the grounds of this stately home.
8. Anthony is supposed|'s supposed (suppose) to hand in his psychology assignment tomorrow.
9. Top businessman, Charles Woodford, has been found (find) guilty of tax fraud in an intriguing court case which finally ended today.
10. It is rumoured|'s rumoured (rumour) that some film companies may refuse to pay famous actors and actresses the money they demand to star in blockbuster movies.
